p: Ribavirin is a guanosine analogue that interferes with the replication of RNA and DNA viruses. 61 In vitro antiviral activities of Ribavirin have been demonstrated in SARS-CoV and MERS-CoV. 61, 62 From the experiences of SARS-CoV, the use of ribavirin as a monotherapy was limited as it required high concentration to inhibit viral replication, and ribavirin usage was associated with dose-dependent haemolysis and liver toxicity. 63, 64 In the treatment of SARS and MERS, ribavirin is used in combination with interferon or lopinavir/ritonavir. 11, 65 The use of ribavirin in combination with interferon or lopinavir/ritonavir is recommended in the latest Chinese National Treatment Guidelines for COVID-19. 66 A recent multicentre randomised phase 2 trial showed triple antiviral therapy of lopinavir/ritonavir, ribavirin, and interferon β-1b was superior to lopinavir–ritonavir alone in alleviating symptoms, shortening the duration of viral shedding and hospital stay in patients with mild-to-moderate COVID-19. 67
